trans-unit.source: Provides a custom constructor for uniform resource identifiers (URIs) and modifies URIs for the <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder> class provides a convenient way to modify the contents of a <xref:System.Uri> instance without creating a new <xref:System.Uri> instance for each modification.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder> properties provide read/write access to the read-only <xref:System.Uri> properties so that they can be modified.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> class.
The default constructor creates a new instance of the <xref:System.UriBuilder> class with its properties initialized as follows.
Property
Initial Value
Fragment
Host
"loopback"
Password
Path
Port
Query
Scheme
"http"
UserName
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> class with the specified URI.

This constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.UriBuilder> class with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A>, and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> properties set as specified in `uri`.
If `uri` does not specify a scheme, the scheme defaults to "http:".
A URI string.
uri is `null`.

In the [.NET for Windows Store apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=247912) or the [Portable Class Library](~/docs/standard/cross-platform/cross-platform-development-with-the-portable-class-library.md), catch the base class exception, <xref href="System.FormatException"></xref>, instead.
uri is a zero length string or contains only spaces.
-or-
The parsing routine detected a scheme in an invalid form.
-or-
The parser detected more than two consecutive slashes in a URI that does not use the "file" scheme.
-or-
uri is not a valid URI.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> instance.

This constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.UriBuilder> class with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A>, <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A>, and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> properties set as specified in `uri`.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> class.
uri is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> class with the specified scheme and host.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName` and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`.

<xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> is initialized to the value -1 to indicate the default port for the scheme should be used, and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property is set to the slash character (/).
An Internet access protocol.
A DNS-style domain name or IP address.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> class with the specified scheme, host, and port.

The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`, and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property set to `portNumber`.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property is set to the slash character (/).
If the `portNumber` is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the `scheme` will be used to connect to the `host`.
An Internet access protocol.
A DNS-style domain name or IP address.
An IP port number for the service.
portNumber is less than -1 or greater than 65,535.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> class with the specified scheme, host, port number, and path.

The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property set to `portNumber` and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property set to `pathValue`.
If the `portNumber` is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the `scheme` will be used to connect to the `host`.
An Internet access protocol.
A DNS-style domain name or IP address.
An IP port number for the service.
The path to the Internet resource.
port is less than -1 or greater than 65,535.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> class with the specified scheme, host, port number, path and query string or fragment identifier.

The <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property set to `schemeName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property set to `hostName`, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property set to `portNumber`, and the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property is set to `pathValue`.
If `extraValue` begins with a number sign (#), then <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> is set to `extraValue`.
If `extraValue` begins with a question mark (?), then <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> is set to `extraValue`.
If the `portNumber` is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the `scheme` will be used to connect to the `host`.
An Internet access protocol.
A DNS-style domain name or IP address.
An IP port number for the service.
The path to the Internet resource.
A query string or fragment identifier.
extraValue is neither `null` nor , nor does a valid fragment identifier begin with a number sign (#), nor a valid query string begin with a question mark (?).
port is less than -1 or greater than 65,535.
Compares an existing <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> instance with the contents of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> for equality.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Equals%2A> method compares a specified <xref:System.Uri> instance with the <xref:System.Uri> instance built by the <xref:System.UriBuilder> instance.
If the two are the same, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Equals%2A> method returns `true`.
The object to compare with the current instance.
`true` if rparam represents the same as the constructed by this instance; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the fragment portion of the URI.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property contains any text following a fragment marker (#) in the URI, including the marker itself.
When setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property, the fragment marker is added to its value.

**Note** In version 1.0 and 1.1 of the .NET Framework, setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to any value, including `null`, cleared the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> property, and setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to `null` or to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> cleared the property.
In version 2.0, however, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> properties are independent.
**Note** Do not append a string directly to this property.

If the length of <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> is greater than 1, retrieve the property value as a string, remove the leading pound sign, append the new query string, and set the property with the combined string.
The fragment portion of the URI.
The fragment identifier ("#") is added to the beginning of the fragment.
Returns the hash code for the URI.
The hash code is generated without including any fragment.
The URIs http://www.contoso.com/index.htm#search and http://www.contoso.com/index.htm generate the same hash code.
The hash codes for <xref:System.Uri> A and B are guaranteed to be the same when A.Equals(B) is `true`.
This method implements <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The hash code generated for the URI.
Gets or sets the Domain Name System (DNS) host name or IP address of a server.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Host%2A> property contains the fully qualified DNS host name or IP address of the server.
The DNS host name or IP address of the server.
Gets or sets the password associated with the user that accesses the URI.
The password of the user that accesses the URI.
Gets or sets the path to the resource referenced by the URI.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property contains the path information that the server uses to resolve requests for information.
Typically this is the path to the desired information on the server's file system; although it also can indicate the application or script that the server must run to provide the information.
The path information does not include the scheme, host name, or query portion of the URI.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Path%2A> property always returns at least a slash (/).
The path to the resource referenced by the URI.
Gets or sets the port number of the URI.
The port number defines the protocol port for contacting the host referenced in the URI.

If a port is not specified as part of the URI, the <xref:System.Uri.Port%2A> property returns the value of -1 to indicate that the default port value for the protocol scheme will be used to connect to the host.
If the <xref:System.Uri.Port%2A> property is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the protocol scheme will be used to connect to the host.
The port number of the URI.
The port cannot be set to a value less than -1 or greater than 65,535.
Gets or sets any query information included in the URI.
The <xref:System.Uri.Query%2A> property contains any query information included in the URI.
Query information is separated from the path information by a question mark (?) and continues to the end of the URI.
The query information returned includes the leading question mark.
The query information is escaped according to RFC 2396.

**Note** In version 1.0 and 1.1 of the .NET Framework, setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to any value, including `null`, cleared the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> property, and setting the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> property to `null` or to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> cleared the property.
In version 2.0, however, the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Fragment%2A> and <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> properties are independent.
**Note** Do not append a string directly to this property.

If the length of <xref:System.UriBuilder.Query%2A> is greater than 1, retrieve the property value as a string, remove the leading question mark, append the new query string, and set the property with the combined string.
The query information included in the URI.
Gets or sets the scheme name of the URI.
The following table lists the valid scheme names for the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Scheme%2A> property.
Scheme
Description
file
The resource is a file on the local computer.
ftp
The resource is accessed through FTP.
gopher
The resource is accessed through the Gopher protocol.
http
The resource is accessed through HTTP.
https
The resource is accessed through SSL-encrypted HTTP.
mailto
The resource is an e-mail address and is accessed through SMTP.
news
The resource is accessed through NNTP.
The scheme of the URI.
The scheme cannot be set to an invalid scheme name.
Returns the display string for the specified <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> instance.

The display string contains the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property value if the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property was set or the port was specified when the <xref:System.UriBuilder> was constructed using of the <xref:System.UriBuilder.%23ctor%2A> methods that accept a port number parameter except for the case when the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A>.property value was set to a value of -1 to indicate the default port.

The display string does not contain the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property value if the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property was not set and a port was not specified when the <xref:System.UriBuilder> was constructed.

The display string also does not contain the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property value if the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Port%2A> property or port number for the constructor was set to a value of -1.
The string that contains the unescaped display string of the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref>.

In the [.NET for Windows Store apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=247912) or the [Portable Class Library](~/docs/standard/cross-platform/cross-platform-development-with-the-portable-class-library.md), catch the base class exception, <xref href="System.FormatException"></xref>, instead.
The <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> instance has a bad password.
Gets the <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> instance constructed by the specified <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> property contains the <xref:System.Uri> created by the <xref:System.UriBuilder>.
Any changes made to the <xref:System.UriBuilder> properties are reflected in the <xref:System.UriBuilder.Uri%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the URI constructed by the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref>.

In the [.NET for Windows Store apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=247912) or the [Portable Class Library](~/docs/standard/cross-platform/cross-platform-development-with-the-portable-class-library.md), catch the base class exception, <xref href="System.FormatException"></xref>, instead.
The URI constructed by the <xref href="System.UriBuilder"></xref> properties is invalid.
The user name associated with the user that accesses the URI.
The user name of the user that accesses the URI.
